alert.note: Alert for Central Middlesex County; Northern Worcester; Northwest Middlesex County; Southern Worcester (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 11:21AM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...Heavy rainfall with minor flooding will impact portions of eastern Worcester and central Middlesex Counties through NOON EDT... At 1120 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Pepperell to near Douglas. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Minor flooding possible for the Worcester metro. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor nuisance flooding of typically flood prone areas. Locations impacted include... Worcester, Lowell, Framingham, Leominster, Fitchburg, Marlborough, Shrewsbury, Chelmsford, Natick, Dracut, Milford, Westford, Acton, Hudson, Westborough, Grafton, Concord, Sudbury, Holden and Webster. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Do not drive through flooded roads or underpasses. Avoid low lying areas near small streams. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. For your safety, go indoors or to your vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Central Middlesex County; Northern Worcester; Northwest Middlesex County; Southern Worcester
